entry.title: Uber Booking Animation
entry.content:
On June this year, I was in San Jose to join WWDC, thatâ€™s the time I saw the waiting animation when I was using Uber to meet a friend at Cupertino Library.

The animation is truly awesome!

Iâ€™m so curious how they did it, therefore I do a little bit exploration.

Preview

Well, the polyline animation still not smooth enough, anyone have a better idea?

Step by Step

Rotate Map

I choosed ï£¿Map as the default map to demo because of two reasons:

  • After WWDC19, Simulator build on top of Meta, Core layer under all of Apples frameworks which MapKit included, Metal takes advantage of GPU of the underlying Mac system
  • Google Map need a developer key to get access, which means you cannot run it directly on simulator after fork the repository from github

ï£¿Map transactions can be tuned by embed in UIView.animate block.

Google Map have to use CATransaction

Pin Animation

We need two CAShapeLayers to do the animation, one for circle, the other for pin.
Notice that the circle will disappear after it reaches to maximum, and the pin have a easeIn curve

Draw Polyline on map

ï£¿Map use MKMapViewDelegate to handle drawing.

Here is how to add Polyline

Animate Polyline

Thatâ€™s the tricky part.

As we see Uburâ€™s animation closely enough, the polyline rotating with map, so thatâ€™s really draw on the map.

What I do is continuing add and remove polylines on map to pretend itâ€™s an animtion.
Also the line has a header and a tail when appearing at beginning and ending at Pin.

Here is the Repository, if you have any better idea, please let me know :)

Update

Well, As screen refresh rate is 60 fps, so it should make totalSteps / duration â‰ˆ 60

entry.title: SKEmitterNode in SpriteKit Scene sks
entry.content:
Particles on iOS needs SpriteKit.

  1. Add a file MyScene.sks in project
  2. Drag a SpriteKit View into Storyboard
  3. Drag two Emitters into MyScene.sks
  4. Setup Emitter properties
  5. Drag actions you want to add on each Emitter

My previous understanding is that

To me surprise is that the SpriteKit can have a similar development experience just like using Storyboard.

The main reason I surrender to iOS Dev is Storyboard, when I saw Paul Hegarty ctrl drag a button to code in his class.

Thatâ€™s amazing!!!

Also I saw many UIDynamic things I used to setup by code.

Glad ğŸ˜„ to have this brief exploring.

entry.title: React Native & Flutter
entry.content:
There are tons of pros and cons already.

ProsCons
React NativeHot Reloading
Online Hot Fixing
Front-End friendly
Cross platform
Fix once
JavaScript
Native UI knowledge on both platform
Debugging
FlutterFlutter Engine
Cross platform
Same UX & UI
Learn Dart
Unstable (1.0 released)
Ugly Code Style
iOS 13?
Debugging
NativeiOS Part
Much easier
AutoLayout, Storyboard
Swift, write less and do more
SpriteKit, UIDynamic		Three developers(fontend, iOS, android) triple budgets

As an iOS developer who is happily following ï£¿ steps, Iâ€™m using Swift, Storyboard and AutoLayout at the very beginning when I dived into iOS dev.

I think thatâ€™s why most native developers donâ€™t want to learn React Native even a bit ğŸ˜£.

Two years ago, I built Mattermost and changed few thing in my previous company to replace Slack, thatâ€™s the first React Native project I touched.

The unhappy thing is itâ€™s very easier to lost in code, I have to search whole project every time want to change something, there is no Storyboard let me know who shows who.

I have a chat with my previous coworker who is a Sr. front-end, he helped me launched the update server which is also written in Node.js, I handover this project to him when I left.

According to him, it is that he donâ€™t know how to wrote native code, as the React Native similar to React.js, why not to use it to try both iOS & Android. Then I asked if he knows how to swift, which tech will he prefer. You can guess the answer ğŸ˜„.

Because from my side, sometimes features are hard to implement even in swift code, thatâ€™s absolutely a long way to achieve by other tech.

Then there is an opportunity to do a demo these days which contains nested magnet scrollviews, buttons, and navigations, Instead of using native code, I step out of my comfort zone and tried React Native as well as Flutter.

Final I think I figured it out.

Basically they shared the same ideas:

  • Views
    • ListView, ScrollView, Labels, Texts, TextFields
  • Actions
    • Drag, Click, Scroll
    • Callback Block or Delegate on view events

So if you skilled any one of them, the rest is to Google how implement it in that framework or read their manual.

React Native

The impressive thing in React Native is state

it can be achieve by didSet of an variable in Swift, and there are also many framework to do it say RxSwift, PromiseKit

Flutter

I used to curious that some apps UX quite like developed by native, but somehow feels weird. Now I know itâ€™s flutter.

  • Thatâ€™s the first time I write once and got two apps(I had so many troubles setting React Native with Android )
  • 0.9 has a bug on Hot reload
  • Dev on Visual Studio Code is pretty good, that remains me the old day writing Golang
  • ugly code style( are they seriously ğŸ˜  about it? thatâ€™s an official example)

Anyway Iâ€™m really impressed it skip native components and written itâ€™s own 2D rendering engine. Thatâ€™s much genius than React Native.

So personally I think Flutter has more potential than React Native. As well as there are so many companies roll back to native.

entry.title: CUDA GPU Accelerated h264/h265/HEVC Video Encoding with Staxrip
entry.content:
Games are reformed my life.

Many cities I traveled to recent years which once I have tours in Assassinâ€™s creed series, sleeping dogs 2, GTA, etc. already.
It has a very impact when I really in there, in the real world. So every time I went back, always want to experience once in games.

But as Iâ€™m getting older and older and olderğŸ‘´, I have less time to play it as beforeğŸ‘±.

RecordingğŸ“¹ while Iâ€™m playing ğŸ® maybe a good idea.

ShadowPlay

As I have a GIGABYTE Geforce GTX 1080 to train deep learning model, so the only thing I need is Nvidia ShadowPlay. Which is prefect for recording games.

But the minimal bitrate is 10Mbps, I want reduce it under 6kbps, so compression ğŸ—œï¸ involved.

Staxrip

I always use FFmpeg before, but feel panic every time I heard the fan of my MacbookğŸ’» noising, and it usually took all nightğŸŒƒ to convert batch videos.

Fortunately I saw Cuda logo this time which reminded the GPU accelerating.

Then I found staxrip, which is awesomeğŸ‘.

  1. Click x264, choose NVIDIA H.265 ( I test on my 1080, it has a similar speed comparing with NVIDIA H.264, I was thought 264 should much fast than 265 ), then it can use GPU to accelerate.
  2. Click Encoder Options, change the mode to VBR, then Video Bitrate appeared.

It can reach 250 frame/s with CPU 40%, GPU 35%.

entry.title: How to download videos concurrently from youtube and batch embed their subtitles
entry.content:
The whole things I want to do is to download some courses which help me a lot on youtube and embed zh-Hans subtitle to the video then submit them to an Chinese website which is not support external subtile.

This thing, may helps the students in China who donâ€™t have a well English and cannot access youtube.

Youtube-dl config

The file path is ~/.config/youtube-dl/config

Download concurrently

Batch translate filenames

After downloaded all the videos in the list, get their names with

ls | grep mkv | sed "s/\.mkv//"

then copy & paste to google to get the translated text, then save it to a zh.txt

Batch embed subtitles

It usually took me a whole night for 20 videos on Intel Core i7, an hour video needs 20 minutes to embed its subtitle.

entry.title: More how to convert video to text
entry.content:
I tried the XFyun, but itâ€™s not really good for the recognize result, so I looking for other recognizer to do some test.

  • QQ

  • Baidu

  • Google

The great news is that they all support PCM type that converted earlier, so I just need to do some change to the shell. When you want to compare the results from different recognizer, just run:

test.sh xfyun.py|baidu.py|qq.py test.mp4|.m4a

Honestly, Googleâ€™s result looks better with a human eyes of a glance.

test.sh

id_key.py

google

entry.title: How to convert video to text
entry.content:
I found XFyun FlySpeechRecognizer do a quite good job on this thing if the audio is mandarin Chinese, it even can recognize some simple English words in hybrid language audio.

There is no need to train a Machine Learning model from very begining to do such things.

XFyun API has some limit that the size should <= 2MB, audio length <= 60s.

Usage ./test.sh test.mp4

Now we can use XFyun to recognize audio.

Here is their document XFyun IFlySpeechRecognizer, but their sample code can not be executed, so I do some fixes.

xfyun.py with Python3:

entry.title: Struct Codable Alamofire Generics
entry.content:
I wrote Swift Generics in protocol and enum a half an year ago in order to solve the network responds data to a Generics type.

After Swift 4, the JSONSerialization way is a bit out of style.

In the updating progress, I found a better way to do it.

Tools:

  • Quicktype
  • Alamofire

Assume we have a Json structure:

After you paste it to Quicktype with select Alamofire extensions, you will get:

Notice the func responseA is a static type only suitable for the spacial API which responds the json you pasted. Therefore we need a generics type for all APIs.

Therefore we can delete the func responseA and define a protocol MYRequest as follows:

Now we can implement different Requset as we want:

Also, we can define another protocol which has the same var api: String { get } in MYRequest in case we have a new CRequset and API upgraded to v2,

Finally, the request in ViewController would like this:

entry.title: How to schedule iMessages on Mac
entry.content:
First open Terminal on your Mac and copy and paste these command lines as follows:

Send iMessage by Shell

You will see a file opened by your default text edit app and the file shows:

Notice that you should replace TEXT with the text you what to send and NAME with the name in your Contacts app.
Donâ€™t forget to Save the file.

Crontab on mac

You should run this line above as the com.vix.cron will check the /etc/crontab is exist or not on macOS.
Type your password of the Mac.

Schedule the shell with Crontab

As the Crontab â€“ Quick Reference shows:

This shell means your Mac will send the iMessage on 10:00 Mar. 25.

Modify it to you ideal time then

The following step you are using vim, I think that is the hardest part.

  1. Press i, you will see -- INSERT -- on the left bottom of the Terminal
  2. Paste 00 10 25 3 * zsh ~/Documents/sendiMessage.sh
  3. Press shift + : then type wq , enter

Check Crontab

crontab -l

You can see 00 10 25 3 * zsh ~/Documents/sendiMessage.sh if everything was right.

entry.title: Batch replace NamedColors to RGB in Storyboard
entry.content:
Updates: 2018-04-15

As the Xcode updated to 9.3, the NamedColors will cause error instead of warning, the shell donâ€™t have to much value.

And there is a fast way to do it by click the color in Storyboard and touch the Hex Color # say â€œFFFFFFâ€ after you choosed the NamedColor.

NamedColors is a new feature that really convenient for developers to use in Xcode
But it is only a available on iOS 11, and it will cause app crash on iOS 10, 9â€¦

The main idea is:

  • Use NamedColors in StoryBoard to avoid fill color every time to benefit the new feature.
  • Replace all NamedColorsâ€™ attributes to RGB in StoryBoard when build the project to avoid crash on iOS old version.

First, save it as NamedColors2RGB.py in your project root folder.

Then, Xcode -> Project File -> Build Phases -> Add Build Phase -> Add Run Script

If you found anyway to reverse it back to NamedColors, please leave a msg to me.

After all, once the NamedColors changed, all the color in the interface builder should be changed too.

entry.title: Building Apps for iPhone X
entry.content:
First, Watching Building Apps for iPhone X with 2x speed to get a glance, it will speed 13/2 minutes.

  • The key point is to open Safe Area in Storyboard.
  • The LayoutConstraint attracted to superview can beyond the Safe Area.

My current app has 17 Storyboards and 28 ViewControllers.

In each ViewController, the previous develepers used an UIView on top to cover the systemâ€™s navigationController to do some tricks, which means the constraint of the view has a height == 64, and top == superview.top.

Although itâ€™s a little disgusting, but it works on previous devices which navigationbarâ€™s height are always 64.

But on iPhone X, it need to use Safe Area. Which means I have better to delete the fake navigationView. But that means move all the buttons, actions, animations to the systemâ€™s navigationController if the segue kind is push.

Honestly to say, itâ€™s much easier than I thought after all works done.

For the segue kind is present modally, the fake view still do its job by changed itâ€™s height only if the device is iPhone X.

Other usefull tools

entry.title: How to trust MitM Certificate on iPhone Simulator
entry.content:
How to trust MitM Certificate on iPhone Simulator

Open Keychain and export the MitM Root certificate as .cer ( not .p12 ), drag it to the simulator, then go to Settings.General.About.CertificateTrustSettings.ENABLE FULL TRUST FOR ROOT CERTIFICATES, open the Switch which is your MitM.

Before that, I dragged .p12, and it can trusted in Settings.General.Profiles, but canâ€™t be see in Settings.General.About.Certificate Trust Settings.

This wasted lots of time, and I found something like: Modify TrustStore.sqlite3

That is terrible. There it no need to say the TrustStore.sqlite3 no longer in at that path.

After read Installing a CAâ€™s Root Certificate on Your Test Device and found nothing.

Iâ€™m glad tried .cer several days later, now I can watch all requests on specific domains by Surge.

entry.title: Softwares speed up your learning
entry.content:
Podcasts and videos are a typical way to study online, but they are numberless and as the collect is in humanâ€™s nature, how to increase this speed become more essential.

Typically, people can deal with native languages at a high speed.
As for me, 2x is comfortable, 3x is acceptable, 4x is fine with subtitle.

Desktop

A few years ago, I used to use Windows when I was still a university student, KMPlayer was the best in all type of video players, because other players may got distorted sound while changing. Later, the author left the company and rewrote a new one with C++ and renamed it to PotPlayer.

As on macOS, Movist is my first choice, which is also come from Korea. needless to say its brilliance and simplicity, it provide 4x without too much losses in audio track.
Other players like MPV, although it provide no rate limit( yes, you can speed up to whatever you like) and open sourced, but you have to modify ~/.config/mpv/mpv.conf each time if you want to change the default settings.

Mobile

The good news is Podcasts on iPhone already have 2x (the odd thing is iTunes Podcasts donâ€™t), and many study type apps also have this useful feature.

But I havenâ€™t found any app provide more than 2x.

According to ï£¿

It seems merely change the player.rate = 3.0 can do it if the audio is a file-based media. Dose this would cause distortion?

Iâ€™ll try it if I spare time one day.

entry.title: Swift Generics in protocol and enum
entry.content:
Swift Generics in protocol and enum

  • protocol can only be used as a generic constraint because it has Self or associated type requirements
  • Protocols do not allow generic parameters; use associated types instead
  • cannot specialize non-generic type

entry.title: Custom UIViewController Presentation Transitions with UIStoryboardSegue
entry.content:
Custom UIViewController Presentation Transitions with UIStoryboardSegue

The most popular way is UIViewControllerAnimatedTransitioning

In order to do that, you have to:

  • New a subclass which may called XXXTransitioning inherit from NSObject and implement two functions of protocol UIViewControllerAnimatedTransitioning

  • Then:

    1. New an instance of the XXXTransitioning in the ViewController
    2. Set transitioningDelegate = self
    3. Extension the ViewController with UIViewControllerTransitioningDelegate and implement

  • Do it again for dismiss

I noticed Storyboard Segue has a Custom Kind

Thatâ€™s it, no more coding delegate and Extension. Simple and clean :)

entry.title: Time Capsule on PandoraBox
entry.content:
Time Capsule on PandoraBox

My OpenWRT is PandoraBox, and the Router is Mi mini
These are a few slight difference with the official wiki

Software

System -> Software -> Configuration

repace all text to:

Then, ssh to your PandoraBox

To your browser

System -> Software -> Actions -> Download and install package

  • netatalk
  • avahi-daemon
  • kmod-usb-storage
  • kmod-fs-hfsplus
  • block-mount

Donâ€™t try opkg install as the wiki says, otherwise youâ€™ll get error:

Format & Mount

Plug your BackUp hard drive to Mi mini

Use blkid to find your sda, this is mine:

Format it to ext4 (Mi mini mounted hfsplus failed, so I tried ext4 as a trade off)

To the browser

System -> Mount Points -> Mount Points -> Add

Select the UUID you get by blkid mount to /mnt/TimeMachine, remember the size xxx MB, save

You may see /dev/sda3 /mnt/TimeMachine in Mounted file systems

Then to your ssh

Netatalk

Replace all text to:

Replace all text to: (fill the xxx you get previously, itâ€™s MiB)

Avahi

Replace all text to:

replace all text to:

To your browser

System -> Startup Enable

  • afpd
  • avahi-daemon

Restart you Router

To your Mac, System Preferences -> Time Machine -> Select Disk -> Available Disks -> on "Time Capsule", you can see TimeMachine

entry.title: How to add Xib on StoryBoard
entry.content:
In the classic 1975 software project management book, The Mythical Man Month: Essays on Software Engineering, Fred Brooks states that, no matter the programming language chosen, a professional developer will write an average 10 lines of code (LoC) day.

StoryBoard is good for saving code lines and improve efficiency, as ï£¿ strongly recommend in each WWDC and continually improve it.

I donâ€™t understand why there are still lots of Team Leaders require their poor programmers to write the UIView in programmatic way.

Maybe they thought some CustomViews are highly reuse usable, and cope paste in StoryBoard would cause the redundant side effect.

So, The main idea of this solution is, cohesion the CustomViews to a Xib then add it on StoryBoard.

This need a few steps as for ï£¿ didnâ€™t support it directly:

  1. add a IBDesignable CustomView.Swift and CustomView.Xib
  2. set the CustomView.xib -> Placeholders -> File's Owner -> Custom Class to CustomView
  3. new a CustomView programmatically and load the root view from CustomView.Xib
  4. add the root view with equal width and height in both horizontal and vertical center on CustomView in init function
  5. now you can drag a View to StoryBoard, and set itâ€™s class to CustomView which can generate a snapshot for preview

But the subviews of CustomView like UIButton canâ€™t wire to ViewController as an @IBOutlet

Delegate or Block can solve this problem.

As for me, I suggest Block way, cause I used Delegate for half a year, and found

  • ViewController will have too many delegates
  • delegate = self have to written in viewDidLoad and sometimes =nil in viewDidDisappear

Block will have less code and more simpler.

Here is the example which may reduce your time.

entry.title: How to learn English as a Chinese
entry.content:
I hate remember words in a brutal way as 99% of Chinese students does. When we were kid, we learned our mother tongue natural without any pain.

So when I was in my poor primary school, I never remember a word.

In fact, the truth is I canâ€™t remember words. Believe it or not, no matter how hard I tried, I just canâ€™t remember them. Each time itâ€™s my rowâ€™s turn to write words on blackboard, I had to watch left and right carefully and copied each character one by one.

As a teenager at that time, Iâ€™m curious that why they can do it. It must be the method incompatible with my brain.

Fortunately, I read another method on a gramma book that a former top scorer announced that she did not remember words either. All she was doing is repeat NCE 100+ times loudly.

Hum, thatâ€™s great, so I tried it and this method helps me a lot, for it let me got a fair score in college entrance examination and passed the CET6 in university, even I did know what Iâ€™m reading sometimes.

Until IELTS, all the English tests early were merely a joke.

And there is another blind spot I realised recently, exam is exam, one should get the point and leave ASAP.

Before that, I firmly believed that as long as my true level raise, I will be capable of the exam with no extra effort like do the test paper everyday.

But in fact, this required a very high quality far more than the exam required, this is an endless road.

14 years passed after first time I got to know English, I feel I just make one little step after I communicated with the resident a few month ago.

Now I know the language is more like an instinct of mankind, when baby grow up, the neurone cells will be cleaned by our brain cause there is no use for our ancestors to learn another language when they were kids, according to evolutionary psychology.

But we are in modern world, as far as I know, there is only two methods which sound reasonable, and more importantly, economic.

  1. æŠŠä½ çš„è‹±è¯­ç”¨èµ·æ¥
    1. èµ–ä¸–é›„ç¾è¯­éŸ³æ ‡
    2. ESLPOD
    3. American Accent Training
    4. Read at least 10 original edition books per year
  2. ä¸€ç‚¹å®ç”¨ä¸»ä¹‰çš„å­¦è‹±è¯­å¿ƒå¾—
    1. Learn 600 GRE words per day
    2. Repeat it by Ebbinghaus forgetting curve
    3. Intensive reading
    4. Past exam paper

Now you see, ironically No. 2 kicks me to origin: I have to remember words!

But at least one things is different this time, I choose it by my free will.

entry.title: Sync macOS ssh config with iCloud
entry.content:
As a developer, I have to restore backups sometime because of the beta system.

Fortunately, most data was on server these days. Not only Safari, Photos, Calendar, Note, Reminders, but also other apps use iCloud storage. This was great progress, I only have to re-download apps from App Store and brew shell after reinstall the system.

But the setting of ssh, configs, etc., were really annoying, furthermore I may lose my private keys.

So I new a folder which named macOS in iCloud Drive folder, and copied all the files without ., For example, .gitconfig ~> gitconfig

In fact, any cloud drive (like Dropbox) can do it, but
considering privacy and this letter A Message to Our Customers written by Tim Cook

iCloud was my choice ;

entry.title: Use AppleScript as AutoHotkey On Mac
entry.content:
For the good test of Soylent 1.6, I bought 20+ boxes recently.
But there was a problem that Safari does not support AutoFill Form in that website. So I have to input full informations of my credit card manually for the transport fee and the tariff.

All the payment steps are merely number, date, cvv, password.

I was broke down after repeated it again and agin.

It should be automated.

For Godâ€™s sake, it occurred to me that the AutoHotkey when I was still using Windows four years ago.

Mac has the AppleScript which can simulate keyboard input and mouse click.

And I found an interesting thing in this process which is the cvv canâ€™t be clicked by the script.

It seems the bankâ€™s website really do something on security.

entry.title: Nothing To Say
entry.content:
Itâ€™s been a long time that I didnâ€™t write anything. Maybe written in English fully is the obstacle.

Too many things happened in these two months.

First, my company failed in series D funding round.

Our CTO had to reduce the design apartmentâ€™s programmers by more than a third and reduce three apps to one. Almost half of the programmers were leave. It seems everything went back to B round happy time.
But, something never went back again.

My project iterated to version 1.6 and be cut. So, there is no more coding job, after that, I went to San Francisco to join WWDC16.

Second, Do what you love.

So, programming is my job, exact to iOS developer after my gap year.

I subscribed many Tech blog when I were work in the beginning, but they never rose my attention again. At the same time, I lost every interest of everything, and donâ€™t want to meet anyone.

It may I have no real hobby cause that, the only former interest was programming.

But finally, I have a little luxury time to relax myself both physically and mentally after I went to Beijing two years ago which was the most suffocating super city in the world.

Third, I did resize how important of the excise when I came back from SFO. Almost every elitist do excise in developed country.

After I did see the blue sky every where, the wide of Pacific Ocean, the green leaf in the sunshine, the house on the hill covered in mist.
I know there is a real better world in the world which is waiting for me.
Keep myself heathy is in top priority, all other things are secondary.

entry.title: The side effect of Polyphasic sleep
entry.content:
I tried Polyphasic sleep when the first time I heard about it. Itâ€™s almost 2 years after that time.

Itâ€™s not a rigorous Polyphasic sleep, for Iâ€™m using 6 hour major sleep episode and three 30-minute power naps. And I use hypnosis when I have naps at the same time.

Itâ€™s really good. Usually Iâ€™ll wake up at 6 in the morning and do tons of work, then I feel tired and have the first nap at 10 or 11 and wake up with many Chinese people. Iâ€™ll have the second nap after lunch, the third when I went home.

This hack method gives me an illusion that daytime is stretched, because every time I wake up from a nap, I feel itâ€™s totally a new day.

But I found a side effect recently, which is the malaise was also magnified. Especially Iâ€™m in anxiety these days.

Itâ€™s not polyphasic sleepâ€™s fault, I think, time to read Burns Davidâ€™s When Panic Attacks.

entry.title: Segmentation fault: 11
entry.content:
• Mac OS X 10.11.4
  • Xcode 7.3
  • Swift 2.2

error: cannot convert value of type '[(String, Int)]' to expected argument type '[(name: String, age: Int)]?'

So, I renamed the tuple list type to [(name: String, age: Int)]

Everything is fine? right?

But when I Archived the project in Fastest, Aggressive Optimizations [-Ofast] and Fast, Whole Module Optimization [-O -whole-module-optimization]

Command failed due to signal: Segmentation fault: 11

The error message is irrelevant and helpless

I checked out commit by commit, and finally found that it was the name of tuple cause the error.

entry.title: Observer
entry.content:
It seems my observer come back.

I began to know the mental models when I was finished be friendly with the time, It took me one month to read that pure thin book.

When I was glad that my mental models improved, The Power of Now: A Guide to Spiritual Enlightenment announced that mind is a trap, the forecast ability of mind focus on the future, it prevent you to know the power of present. These different arguments confused me at that time. As I continues to read, the concept of observer appeared in my eyes.

For the first time I heard about observer was in my college. I read that word from The dark forest. Itâ€™s more fascinating after I read one book about quantum mechanics.

There is also an idea about observer in psychology. It is not only different from the idea above(Observer (quantum physics)) but also Design Patterns(Observer pattern). When I finished Think on These Things one year later, I try to build an observer about myself.
Because usually things will be more clear when you saw others doing it. The weakness and blind spot is apparent and evident, you will find better solution.

It is glad that I achieved this goal in my gap year, there was two versions of me, one acting, one watching.
I do not think the observer equals to superego, but it is clearly a guardian of ego.

But when I worked to Beijing one year and a half ago, all the works I builded ruined. The observer of me was gone. I had some new bed habits like watch the watch frequently which reveal my anxious and nervous.

When I do something wrong, I felt exhausted. Luckily I had a long vacation that I went to my parentâ€™s home. Although that town is not an outfield, but at least it detach me from the supercity. Also, I have some deep talks about my dreams with my parents. They feels helpless because our poor family and the rising hotel rates, and they cannot understand why Iâ€™m acting so odd.

After 10 days later my vacation due, I felt relief.

entry.title: Chrome to Safari
entry.content:
I use Chrome from the very beginning. I was impressed by it is simplicity and variety. Even I upgrade my laptop to Macbook, Iâ€™m still using it because of three main reasons

  • Plugin
  • Shortcut
  • Develop
  • Flash

But after my TL amway me, I tried Safari deeply, and found:

Plugin

  • Adblock Plus
  • 1Password
  • Evernote
  • AutoPagerize
  • Clean Links for Google

Shortcut

I can use opt+cmd+> on Chrome to change tabs, it is shift+cmd+[ on Safari
shift+cmd+z to unclose the most recent closed tabs, itâ€™s no corresponding key on Safari, I can only use history instead.

Develop

I used to opt+cmd+i in chrome to simulate iPhone, I can compare iOS version with front end in this way.
When I got to know whatâ€™s safariâ€™s Develop look like, (cmd+, -> Advanced -> Show Develop menu in menu bar or opt+cmd+r) I surrendered.

![](/images/Safari Develop.png)

Flash

Finally, I accept that different device have their own place. So as for most Chinese video Website still using flash, I chose chrome to watch them.

entry.title: iOS App Submission Nightmare
entry.content:
iOS App Submission Nightmare

bluetooth-peripheral

  1. the bluetooth correlative code no longer be used after redesgin app, you should del both code and:
  2. Targets -> Capabilities -> bluetooth

com.apple.security.application-groups

  1. close app group
  2. del *.entitlements
  3. grep -R --include="*.*" ".entitlements" . youâ€™ll find hidden entitlements in Xcode -> imeican -> build setting

ITMS-90394 Missing Icon

  • We have *29x29@3x.png in Xcode
  • In fact the .png is a .svg
  • new a real *29x29@3x.png

ITMS-90205 90206

Embed Frameworks Archive del carthage copy-frameworks

.bcsymbolmap'> as expected

  • Enable Bitcode

ITMS-90087 90209 x84_64 i386

  • Targets(Embed Frameworks) -> Run Script

entry.title: When a company become bigger
entry.content:
Do the right thing much more importent than doing things right. the former phrase means you have your own argument and reason. The right measures your own justice and can you responsible for your own actions. But when you joined to a big company, your manager concerned is that can you doing things right. That is why startup companies have more energy.

Humans are by nature social animals, if a group has less than 140 people, it can managed by itself. Because everyone knows what others doing, they can easily have a common points of view about someone, there is no place for cribbers. But when the group become bigger, fog and shadow are appear, your ability and capability largely depend on your manager, itâ€™s no longer based on your real contributions.

Most companies have hundreds of employees, thatâ€™s why office politics so common in big companies. How to dealing with office politics is in primary. After all, it related to your salary and promotion. If you want that, the best way is to become a politician, everyone knows whatâ€™s going on, but no one point out, just like The Emperorâ€™s New Clothes. the risk is you may lose yourself.

Thatâ€™s why an excellent startup company so attracting, but there always will be one day, the company become big as for itâ€™s excellent. More and more strangers are joined, not everyone are friendly. if you still be yourself, and careless about politics, that may cause inappropriate, gossip will be everywhere, and when the new year come, you have no promotion without rhyme or reason.

The neutral way was working like an android, donâ€™t share any of your emotions and feelings, that will makes your colleagues feels some kind of professional. The disadvantage is that there is no chance you will be consider as a friend. but as for the company already changed ( not a startup any more ), itâ€™s more acceptable than the previous one.

entry.title: Harvard Positive Psychology
entry.content:
I have watched this course in my gap year, and captured many screenshots. This course helps me a lot. For I clear up my old pictures today incidentally, Itâ€™s time to turn them to text.

Psychological maturity is about the ability to willingly shift perspective.

Goal

The step on the way to a destination that you deem valuable that is important to you.

So end goal can often be liberating.

One of the reasons is because love, and especially lust and passion wears over time.

They are also extremely sensitive, wise, way beyond their years, saintly, generous, benevolent

Exercise

The wonder drug: 30 minutes of physical exercise, 4 times a week.
At least 15 minutes of mindful exercise 6 or 7 times a week.

I have so many things to do.

Exercise should be the last thing to go. It is an investment.

You may lose that 45 minutes. But youâ€™ll gain so much more. Itâ€™s such a good investment. Your memory actually gets better when you exercise. So youâ€™ll get more buck for the bank in terms of time you study; your creativity and concentration levels go up

Whether you have ADD or not, especially if you have.

Relationship

People stay together out of a sense of duty, out of habit, because they think this is their lot in life.

A lack of alternative

â€œdo unto others what you would unto yourself.â€

â€œdo not do unto yourself what you would not do unto others.â€

Love

â€œPerfect love is rare indeed - for to be a lover will require that you continually have the subtlety of the very wise, the flexibility of the child, the sensitivity of the artist, the understanding of the philosopher, the acceptance of the saint, the tolerance of the scholar and the fortitude of the certain.â€

But while perfect love doesnâ€™t exist, true love dose. True love exists between imperfect humans.

I will find that right person. I donâ€™t believe that. Itâ€™s simply not true. Itâ€™s not the matter of faith.

So what makes relationship unique? Itâ€™s not finding that one right person. Once again itâ€™s cultivating that one chosen relationship. Itâ€™s by virtue of working together, of being together, of spending time together, of dedicating one another. Thatâ€™s how we create the one chosen relationship. Thatâ€™s how we create the one chosen relationship.

entry.title: However, no eggs
entry.content:
I got the score last night and was shocked.

For these days I always check my score, but as itâ€™s mid-autumn festival and National Day, they didnâ€™t publish the score.

Three months ago, I had planned to take the exam again for the third time if I do not pass the last one. I only got a 5 on the first one, But I just wanted to gauge my real level in English. the score was totally acceptable. But for this time, even though I didnâ€™t prepare either, I do a lot about the speaking part because I had one hour class with a foreign teacher everyday. And the last time, I didnâ€™t even finished the second part, and for this time, I talked a lot with the examiner and made him laughed, so I think it will be at least 5+. But as the result, itâ€™s still be 4.5.

For the reading and listening part, I increased them 0.5 for each, as I donâ€™t have time to finish the second paragraph last time, itâ€™s reasonable. But for the writing part, itâ€™s decreased 0.5, so the total score was still 5.0.

It was hard for me to accepted this fact, because it not only means that my hard work was wasted but it also indicated where my actual limit is.

It made my sick for several hours, should I insist or re-plan?

According to TaiJi, I should reorder my schedule and base it on the fact, not illusion.

After all, I have to achieve goals step by step as a Diaosi.

But, I still need a little bit of time to heal this sorrow.

PS: the title means â€œç„¶å¹¶åµâ€ in Chinese.

entry.title: Summer Ends
entry.content:
Summer Ends
Itâ€™s a nice music, for summer really ends.

I wrote less, read less and felt bad in this year, before this, Iâ€™m in my gap year, and was productive and efficient, mind flow came up . So, I began to wonder why and try to return.

For I went to the gopher China in April, and meet with one IT crop. CTO, and talk to him that maybe Iâ€™m in a bottleneck period.

But itâ€™s September now, the summer ends, Iâ€™ve been in Beijing for a most one year, and still trapping in this mass state.

I tried to figure out

The model

First, the style of living (surviving in deed) was not like Hangzhou, when I was in Hangzhou, I can rent a flat which company was nearby that I can walk to work, and I have my own bathroom in my room so one bother me. But in Beijing, if I still use the same model, I have to live in an old flat, which the building was even old than me! even worse, I have to live with neighbors, share the bathroom kitchen and all other things. So you have to pray for your neighbors are good.
For me, as an internal person, I just want to live alone.

Once I resize this cause, I rent a new flat immediately and Iâ€™ll move in the end of this month, but one year past and never came back.

English

I read at least 10 books each month before, but for I narrowed to English edition recent months, the numbers dropped so fiercely that I hardly finished a book in one month.

No books makes me feel sick, and no input, no output. Thatâ€™s an important reason that I stopped posting blog and The little master series. Needless to say I forced myself all new blogs have to write in English.

Procrastination

It seems a universal problem. But after I read too much GTDs and found the healthy circle based on polyphasic sleep. I can do 16+ pomodoroes one day.
After I return to work in company, I just do what I want do, and I thought I was still efficient.

Even though I already outsource apply instead DIY, preparing IELTS and working hard still a big challenge to me, not only because I unknown the starting date but also my co-workers ungelivable. I have to write almost 70% codes in the main project and even to rewrote some functions off his part. I want to figure out one way to manage our new team( for right now I like a TL assistant)

So, all the apps that I used were return, and I feels it really improve my situation.

Slack

Itâ€™s not that Slack, although I have to write some code according to itâ€™s API in future for our CI.

I found something I runaround but I have to face it again in future with more effort. like hope my co-workers write more, read the translate version books, excise, etc.

So, I dared not hope anymore.

Thatâ€™s all, winter is coming.

entry.title: Little tips about rewrite an iOS app
entry.content:
I finished my Gap year and went to my current company last autumn.

I didâ€™t do much as a new comer for the first month, and there was a software engineer from AMAP with 10 years experience. Everytime I had something to ask him, he explained it in the deepest level, and inspired me by rhetorical questions patiently. But at the same time, I found thousands and thousands Copy & Paste lines of code in the project. Yes, I counted it by using CLOC, and found that itâ€™s almost 20 thousands lines in total.

As Objective-C is a excessively long and prolix programming language( which means that your have to write dozens of code to implement the same function which may only a line in Ruby ğŸ˜« ), itâ€™s rational for the count of this project. But Copy & Paste should always avoided, worse I saw global variables and magic numbers are everywhere.ğŸ˜°

Itâ€™s odd, isnâ€™t it? If a 10 years experienced programer who can deal with pointer easily and knows computer systems deeply, why didnâ€™t he pay any attention to the code styles. After all, we need to prepare for adding new members in the team and new features at any time.

He said that most of code was written by him, itâ€™s quick to fix bugs. However, he went to a start company of his friend in next month. So he just left, and also, the anfractuosity code.ğŸ˜­ğŸ˜­ğŸ˜­

to be continuedâ€¦

entry.title: Xcode 6.x cannot run on EI Capitan
entry.content:
I watched WWDC and updated OS X to EI Capitan(10.11).
Everything seemed fine until I opened Xcode:

You canâ€™t use this version of the application â€œXcodeâ€ with this version of OS X.
You have â€œXcodeâ€ 6.x.

Swift 2.0 is awesome, but according to Apple, if you want to submit an app which written by 2.0 to App Store, you need to wait until September.

Fortunately I found a hack command:

Which means you run Xcode from /dev/null and redirect output & error output to /dev/null in background.

Everything perfect in past several weeks.

entry.title: How to update homebrew daily
entry.content:
How to update homebrew daily

Example

The $Path must be your files full path

Itâ€™s weird that launchctl start didnâ€™t work, so I had to added

It will run immediately after the plist be loaded.

CreatingLaunchdJobs
Appleâ€™s document is so specific, so I just wrote some mistakes that I made

Be careful of the Lable

first I thought that this was unique, so I changed it

but when I loaded launchctl load launchd.plist after I finished the plist, it yeild:

launchd.plist: Invalid or missing service identifier

hence the <key> can not changed

Owner

Itâ€™s puzzled brew update if the user of the runner shell was system instead of ME. So I tested by users, luckily, It was ME

But if you want to log your logs, itâ€™s better to written in your personal document, after all, the owner of the /var/log/ is root wheel, youâ€™ll get the Permission denied

zsh

Just write down #!/usr/local/bin/zsh (you can get yours by which zsh) at the beginning of the *.sh

chmod a+x $launchd.sh

Finally donâ€™t forget x

entry.title: Homebrew cannot run C compiled programs
entry.content:
I canâ€™t resist the temptation to upgrade my Mac to 10.11, but several tragedies happened, such as:

  • Proxifier - could not initialize Proxifier kext ( I already sent an email to the author, and replied that they are working to find a real reason of this error.)
  • istat menus - I never see it again, but canâ€™t watching the network traffic which seems not a big deal
  • cleanmymac - I download the newest version as it guided and sadly found that they are the same version

but brew - configure: error: cannot run C compiled programs.

so, brew doctor , it shows:

Warning: You are using OS X 10.11.
We do not provide support for this pre-release version.
You may encounter build failures or other breakage.

Warning: Your Xcode (6.3.2) is outdated
Please update to Xcode 7.0.
Xcode can be updated from the App Store.

Then setup my Xcode-beta as the system default Xcode

:)

entry.title: Xcode plugins faild to be loaded after updated
entry.content:
You can type the command in terminal after Xcode updated

this will added your new Xcode UUID to DVTPlugInCompatibilityUUID

But that is a risky way, for instance my Xcode 6.3.2 always crash after I ran this command without brain.

So I had to open the folder ~/Library/Application Support/Developer/Shared/Xcode/Plug-ins and deleted some suspicious plugins.

Of course also you can check the tail -f /var/log/system.log, and found which plugin cause the Xcode crash exactly in ~/Library/Logs/DiagnosticReports/Xcode_$time_$macbookname.crash

Finallyï¼Œwith my best wishes :)

entry.title: What I talk about when I talk about running
entry.content:
ä¹¦ä¸­é‡å¤´è‡³å°¾å¼¥æ¼«è¿™ä¸€ç§è‹è€çš„æ°”æ¯
å¯¹äºæ—¶é—´çš„æµé€ï¼Œè‚‰ä½“èƒ½åŠ›çš„ä¸‹é™ï¼Œå´åˆæ— å¯å¥ˆä½•

ä¸è´¸ç„¶æŠµæŠ—ï¼ŒåšæŒä¸æœè€ä¸åŒæ˜¯çš„ï¼Œä½œè€…é€æ¸æ¥å—è¿™ä¸ªäº‹å®ï¼Œå¹¶ä»¥æ­¤ä¸ºè§„åˆ™åº”å¯¹

å¾ˆå¤šæˆ‘å¥½å¥‡çš„é—®é¢˜ï¼Œä½œè€…ä¹Ÿåæ€è¿‡å¹¶ä¸”æ›´åŠ æ·±å…¥

è¿™å¤§æ¦‚å°±æ˜¯ï¼š

Iâ€™m the kind of person who likes to be by himself.

I stop every day right at the point where I feel I can write more. Do that, and the next dayâ€™s work goes surprisingly smoothly. I think Ernest Hemingway did something like that. To keep on going, you have to keep up the rhythm. This is the important thing for longCterm projects.

Iâ€™m the type of person who doesnâ€™t find it painful to be alone. I find spending an hour or two every day running alone, not speaking to anyone, as well as four or five hours alone at my desk, to be neither difficult nor boring.

I ran a bar, so I learned the importance of being with others and the obvious point that we canâ€™t survive on our own.

The clouds are mere guests in the sky that pass away and vanish, leaving behind the sky.

itâ€™s precisely because people are different from others that theyâ€™re able to create their own independent selves.

I had to give it everything I had. If I failed, I could accept that. But I knew that if I did things halfheartedly and they didnâ€™t work out, Iâ€™d always have regrets.

I only began to enjoy studying after I got through the educational system and became a soCcalled member of society.

Weâ€™d closed the club, so we also decided that from now on weâ€™d meet with only the people we wanted to see and, as much as possible, get by not seeing those we didnâ€™t. We felt that, for a time at least, we could allow ourselves this modest indulgence.

It was my real schooling. But you canâ€™t keep up that kind of life forever. Just as with school, you enter it, learn something, and then itâ€™s time to leave.

Iâ€™m struck by how, except when youâ€™re young, you really need to prioritize in life, figuring out in what order you should divide up your time and energy. If you donâ€™t get that sort of system set by a certain age, youâ€™ll lack focus and your life will be out of balance

In other words, you canâ€™t please everybody

Life just isnâ€™t fair, is how it used to strike me. Some people can work their butts off and never get what theyâ€™re aiming for, while others can get it without any effort at all.

It suits me. Or at least because I donâ€™t find it all that painful.

The most important thing we ever learn at school is the fact that the most important things canâ€™t be learned at school

while theyâ€™re getting by on these, they may actually discover real, hidden talent within them

Iâ€™ve always done whatever I felt like doing in life. People may try to stop me, and convince me Iâ€™m wrong, but I wonâ€™t change.

My own individual, stubborn, uncooperative, often selfCcentered nature that still doubts itselfâ€”that, when troubles occur, tries to find something funny, or something nearly funny, about the situation.

This takes time, of course, but sometimes taking time is actually a shortcut.

entry.title: Pull to Refresh UIViewController in iOS
entry.content:
If you force to add a UIRefreshControl to a UIViewController, you will get an error:
UIRefreshControl may only be managed by a UITableViewController

So, here is the trick

Code

1 init a tableView in your UIViewController

2 add refreshControl to tableView, not view

3 refreshView function

If you like to use Storyboard like me

  1. Storyboard -> UITableViewController -> enable Refreshing
  2. Then you can Ctrl drag just like UIButton

entry.title: xmlParseEntityRef no name AND Input is not proper UTF-8
entry.content:
I found that the RSS of my blog was dead a few days ago.

First, I thought itâ€™s a bug of the theme, so I updated the theme today, but the problem was still there.

It yelled like this:

I Googled and found that it was a silly problem just because I felt that itâ€™s cool using & rather than and.
The truth is that & will conflict with HTML tags and it costed me 1 hour.

But after that, The RSS was still not resurrection.

It said something in the graveyard.

It seems some odd characters exist in that article.

After check the syntax of RSS feeds of my blog on Feed Validation Service

It shows this:

Coping the text to Sublime

What a surpriseâ€¦

entry.title: How to Get the Most out of Your University Years
entry.content:
å¦‚ä½•å……åˆ†åˆ©ç”¨å¤§å­¦æ—¶å…‰

What is the best advice you can give to someone attending their first year at a university? (Quora)
å†™ç»™å¤§ä¸€æ–°ç”Ÿçš„æœ€å¥½çš„å¿ å‘Š

For the first four weeks, put lots of effort into your social life. Never eat alone. Knock on doors and chat with people. Figure out interesting things to do in the area, then invite people there on weekends. Basically, become far more extroverted than you are normally, and spread your social efforts over a large number of people so you end up with a large number of semi-close friends.

æœ€åˆçš„å››ä¸ªæ˜ŸæœŸï¼Œåœ¨ä½ çš„ç¤¾äº¤æ–¹é¢ä¸‹åŠŸå¤«ã€‚ä¸è¦ç‹¬è‡ªç”¨é¤ã€‚å»åˆ«çš„å¯å®¤è½¬è½¬å¹¶ä¸”å’Œä»–ä»¬èŠèŠã€‚ææ¸…æ¥šè¿™é™„è¿‘å“ªé‡Œå¥½ç©ï¼Œç„¶åå‘¨æœ«çš„æ—¶å€™é‚€è¯·ä»–ä»¬å»ã€‚è¦ä»æ ¹æœ¬ä¸Šå˜çš„æ¯”ä½ å¹³æ—¶å¤–å‘ï¼Œå¹¶ä¸”æŠŠä½ çš„ç¤¾äº¤æ‹“å±•åˆ°è®¸å¤šäººèº«ä¸Šï¼Œè¿™æ ·ç»“æŸçš„æ—¶å€™ï¼Œå°±æœ‰ä¸å°‘å…³ç³»è¿˜ä¸é”™çš„æœ‹å‹ã€‚

Then pick a few of those people to get closer to. Spend more time hanging with them and less time hanging with the others. You should still be friendly with the others in case your close friendships donâ€™t pan out, but you shouldnâ€™t necessarily see or talk to them every day. This will give you time to develop deeper relationships and focus on your studies.

ç„¶åä»ä¸­æŒ‘é€‰ä¸€äº›äººä½œä¸ºç»§ç»­å‘å±•ç›®æ ‡ã€‚æŠŠä¹‹å‰ä½ èŠ±åœ¨å…¶ä»–äººèº«ä¸Šçš„æ—¶é—´æŠ•å…¥åˆ°å’Œè¿™äº›äººçš„äº¤å¾€ä¸­å»ã€‚åŒæ—¶ä½ åº”è¯¥ç»§ç»­å¯¹å…¶ä»–äººå‹å–„ï¼Œä»¥é˜²æ­¢ä½ ä¹‹å‰é€‰çš„äººå¯¹ä½ æ— æ„Ÿï¼Œä½†è¿™ä¸ä»£è¡¨ä½ è¦æ¯å¤©è§ä»–ä»¬å¹¶ä¸”æ¯å¤©éƒ½æ­è¯ã€‚è¿™æ ·çš„è¯ï¼Œä½ å°†æ—¶é—´å»å‘å±•æ¯”è¾ƒæ·±å±‚æ¬¡çš„å…³ç³»ä»¥åŠé›†ä¸­ç²¾åŠ›å»å­¦ä¹ ã€‚

Take a light course load your first term and study some of the material over the summer. That way you can spend your time meeting new people instead of stressing over academics.

ç¬¬ä¸€å­¦æœŸé€‰äº›è½»é‡çº§çš„è¯¾ç¨‹ï¼Œç„¶åæš‘å‡çš„æ—¶å€™é€‰é‡è¦çš„è¯¾ã€‚ç”¨è¿™ç§æ–¹æ³•ä½ å¯ä»¥èŠ‚çœæ—¶é—´ä»¥ä¾¿ç”¨æ¥ç»“äº¤æ–°æœ‹å‹è€Œä¸æ˜¯å»å¾æœå­¦æœ¯å†…å®¹

During the fall and winter you should apply for summer jobs that will boost your resume. If you want internships go to the career fair and have a look around (donâ€™t forget your resume!). If you want a lab position you should start emailing professors around November. There are also various summer programs you can apply for (google â€œresearch experiences for undergraduatesâ€). Either way it is best to start early on these things.

ç§‹å­£å’Œå†¬å­£çš„æ—¶å€™ï¼Œä½ å°±åº”è¯¥ç”³è¯·æš‘æœŸå·¥ä½œä»¥ä¾¿ç»™ä½ çš„ç®€å†å¢è‰²ã€‚å¦‚æœä½ æƒ³å®ä¹ ï¼Œåº”è¯¥å»æ‹›è˜ä¼šçœ‹çœ‹ï¼ˆåˆ«å¿˜å¸¦ä½ çš„ç®€å†ï¼‰ã€‚å¦‚æœä½ æƒ³åœ¨å®éªŒå®¤å®ä¹ ï¼Œä½ åº”è¯¥åœ¨åä¸€æœˆå·¦å³çš„æ—¶å€™å°±ç»™æ•™æˆå‘ Emailã€‚å½“ç„¶ä¹Ÿæœ‰å¾ˆå¤šåˆ«çš„é¡¹ç›®ä¾›ä½ ç”³è¯·ï¼ˆç™¾åº¦ â€œå®ä¹ ç”Ÿâ€ï¼‰ã€‚ä¸Šè¿°æ— è®ºé€‰å“ªä¸ªï¼Œéƒ½åº”è¯¥å°½æ—©å¼€å§‹ã€‚

Get enough sleep. It will really help you focus in class. It will also help you avoid the cycle where youâ€™re too tired to study, but you canâ€™t sleep because you have too much work to do.

entry.title: Count Lines of Code
entry.content:
When I was reading iOS 7 Programming Cookbook, it occurred to me that how many lines of Obj-c codes exactly I have written.

I used to use SourceCounter to do this earlier when I was still in Windows OS.

But SourceCounter do not support Mac OS X.

So, I found and interesting commond line:

â€œ^$â€ means blank line
â€œwc -lâ€ means WordCount line

I still recommend another tool which is written by Perl:

CLOC - Count Lines of Code

Install:

Use

Here is result of my codes

entry.title: iOS Programming - Big Nerd Ranch Guides
entry.content:
1 day = 15 PomoToDo = 90 pages
So, I not only passed this book just in one week, but also wrote all the code in the samples to Xcode.

But I still feel a little bit of slower in this progress, considering my programming language skills, especially learning Go in a few weeks.

I think the biggest obstacle isnâ€™t Objective-C but iOSâ€™s framework.

By the way, if I learn MFC or Android in school with heart, this may be faster and easier for me now.

And another big thing is the Nature Language or just English. Because the latest documents of iOS dev are all written in Englishâ€¦

As you know, iOS 7 & Obj-C were something old after iOS 8 and Swift were coming at the same time in this WWDC. But a lot of books of Chinese version are still using xib or even MRCâ€¦ And most of all, English is not my mother tongue.

All in all, Cookbook should be read in the next step.

entry.title: global gitignore
entry.content:
xxx.xcodeproj/project.xcworkspace/xcuserdata/xxx.xcuserdatad/UserInterfaceState.xcuserstate

I was annoyed by this file.

It seems xCode update this file almost every second.
So, everytime I wanted to merge two heads, I would get a yellow conflict notification with this advantage functionâ€¦

All in all, I forgot to set a global gitignore files.

This file is in your home directory, which means ~/.gitignore.

And, I found a very good website

http://www.gitignore.io/

According to your Operating System, IDE, or Programming Language, it can generate a ignore list.

Here is Xcodeâ€™s:

Do you see that *.xcuserstate above?

And your can also install it on your system by command line.

Then, you can list it by gi xcode or append it by gi xcode >> ~/.gitignore

entry.title: The Entrepreneur's Credo
entry.content:
ç¾å›½ä¼ä¸šå®¶ä¹‹ä¿¡æ¡

çœ‹èµ·æ¥å¾ˆé¸¡å†»ï¼Œå¤§è‡´æ„è¯‘äº†ä¸‹ï¼Œè¡¨å¤ªè¾ƒçœŸ

I will not trade my freedom for beneficence nor my dignity for a handout.

æˆ‘ä¸ä¼šæ‹¿ è‡ªç”±å»äº¤æ¢æ©æƒ ï¼Œæ‹¿å°Šä¸¥å»ä¹æ±‚æ•‘æµ

to think and act for myself;

to enjoy the benefit of my creations;

and to face the world boldly and say:

â€œThis, with Godâ€™s help, I have done.â€

ç»¼ä¸Šæ‰€è¯‰ï¼Œæœ‰äº†ç¥çš„å¸®åŠ©ï¼ˆå“‡é ï¼Œé‡ç‚¹ç»ˆäºå‡ºç°äº†ï¼‰ï¼Œæˆ‘ç»ˆäºæå®šäº†ï¼ˆPS: å¦‚æœæ²¡ä¸Šé¢é‚£å¥ï¼Œæ˜¯å¦åº”è¯¥è¯‘æˆâ€œæˆ‘å·²ç»å®Œè›‹äº†â€ â†’_â†’ï¼‰ã€‚

entry.title: How to install reaver on Mac OS X
entry.content:
update: 2017-05-24 09:03:10

Sorry about this post, I did not realise how dangerous it is earlier.

Last October my net was overdue, I reaver a wifi for a tmp use for the new net needed national day holiday past.

I found my TV (android system) had a subtitle which said â€œThis net is only for my personal use, is that you have some problem?â€ when I played the Open Yale Courses - Listening to Music on my NAS.

I was shock by this, my NAS has a PandoraBox System, I use it as a bridging, usually my TV should not a appear on their router. It is clearly this wifi which I reavered is a phishing wifi, and my TV was hacked.

So, if some stupid apps were still using http, all my data was exposed. Even https have a MitM problem. ï£¿â€™s products say iOS, macOS have a login trusted Certificates in Keychain, but what for Android? Some devices have they own back doors.

As for my TV, I think it used adb connect <TV IP address> which is Android Debug Bridge (adb) Wireless Debugging Over Wi-Fi.

However, I changed most password laterly.

So, you can try reaver for tech explore, but nerve use it.

update: 2015-07-27 13:14:32

I wrote this in 2014-05-11, however after one year late, you can easily install reaver by using Homebrew right now.

Thanks for Rustamâ€™s tips

I always use beini in vmware, and plug an extra usb wireless adapter to my PC every time.

When I have my Mac, I just copy beiniâ€™s VMX from Windows to Mac, which means I still have to use the wireless adapter.

In fact, minidwep or inflator are using Reaver as a powerful tool to â€¦ (You know it), and Mac is a unix based system, which can run Reaver directly.

  1. Download: reaver-osx.zip
    ( tips: the original reaver-1.4 canâ€™t direct make on Mac )
  2. unzip reaver-osx.zip

Enjoin it & Donâ€™t be evil :-)

entry.title: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire
entry.content:
When I read Chinese version of HP4, I was still in junior middle school.

In the final battle, One of my classmate was amused by Avada Kedavra VS. Expelliarmus, and I had the same feeling.

Because Harry should beat Voldemort and fight endless Death Eaters all by himself, and married Hermione Qiu Ginnyâ€¦ if itâ€™s a Chinese novel.

And now, I no longer a child and begin to realize how brave Harry is.

entry.title: Learn more study less
entry.content:
When I was in high shool, there was a student in my class. For the first time in my life I saw an intellect.

I never saw he was studing. Playing games or reading novels were all the things I can see.

There are also some studiaholics, which means they can approach the intellects on score through hard work.

Sadly turth is I was none of them.

I studied harder and harder, but the score was still no improve.

You can image how desperate I was, which means they are gifted and talented, and I was nothing. Iâ€™m a losser even when I was born.

After so many years have passed, I was undertood that it was just the brainâ€™s magic.

This book, written by an intellect, describe â€œHow the Steel was Temperedâ€.

There Is Always Hope, Thank God.

entry.title: Taichi Chuan
entry.content:
2013-11-17 11:40:48

I watched a video of Xiaoxin Chen before practice.

I didnâ€™t think Dantian is exist, because it was not scientific.
But it seems something true on my resent experience.

Ignoring traditional Chinese view of it(sea of Qi), the lower dantian seems like the center of balance and gravity.
And I also found the same theory on wikipedia.

Here is a simple way to how take advantage of it:

  1. Close your eyes
  2. Simplify your body in to a matchstick men
  3. Imaging your eyes in the lower dantian(which means you are in your gravity center)
  4. practice

notice:
Youâ€™ll find that youâ€™re hardly to STAND ON ONE LEG WITH EYES CLOSED, but itâ€™s OK after a few days.
And if you have no problem with that, congratulations! You have a tremendous balance talent.

2013-11-10

I found Chen-style when I was in college, Studied the new frame.

Nowadays I really feels something, is that QI?
I practices it for two weeks, because my back and neck were pain again.

I always want to finish the frame in a little time, especially as a young man, but

Empty yourself of everything. Maintain a steady serenity.
â€”â€”Tao Teh Ching 16

I know I should feel my bodyâ€™s change. Moving in a very slowly way is one mothed.

In the process, my body become warm, and my bones make popping sounds, which was fun.
And I can feels my spine was corrected.
I canâ€™t wait to see what will happen to me after one month.

entry.title: Use Github Pages as a blog
entry.content:
Finally, I found here since I wanted a blog of my own several months ago.

There are a lot of Public blogs such as douban, sina, but none of them I liked.

I just want a place where no one knows me, and I can record some of my weird experience or ideas.

Qzone was my long used blog, but all people in there were my friends or colleagues. I do not want to treated as a Psychopathy. ^_^

I followed jekyllrb, step by step, it seems worked, the page was online!

(Now, Iâ€™m using Hexo instead of jekyll)

In fact, I heard github can be used as a Blog from one of my schoolmates one year ago. But this task was put off day by day. I thought that there must be a lot configs to setup. Not only I do not like complications, but also as a procrastinator.

English Is Killing Me, I havenâ€™t had enough capability to do this.
